title: Rambles in Europe in 1839. With sketches of prominent surgeons, physicians, medical schools, hospitals, literary personages, scenery, etc
author: Gibson, William
snippet: Of unquestionable native talent and originality, joined to unflinching application, Dr. Hall has pushed his way to eminence by his own individual merits and exertions—without any of the adventitious aids and trickeries which men of limited capacity and scanty acquirements so often resort to, successfully, to blind and bamboozle the public. Even before he graduated, and whilst a student in the Royal Infirmary of Edinburgh, he delivered lectures on Diagnosis, and published reviews and essays in periodical journals. From that period to the present time, a space of nearly thirty years, he has been a most diligent and laborious cultivator of almost every branch of medical science, as his works, which speak for themselves, amply testify.
